definition: Palace in the Moon (in folk tales)
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
surname Gong

sentences.english: And outside the palace, there was a sweet-scented osmanthus tree and a lumberjack called Wu Gang.
sentences.chinese: 月宫外，还有一棵桂花树和一个叫吴刚的伐树人。

sentences.english: According to the legend, the fairies from the Moon Palace would pour down sweet dews to the mortal world.
sentences.chinese: 传说中秋这天晚上，月宫的仙女会把甘露洒向人间。

sentences.english: It is much more beautiful here than the moon.
Moon palace is the beautiful hotel in the moon.
sentences.chinese: 月宫月亮是美丽的酒店。

definition: Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
underground palace of ghouls, e.g. Asgard of Scandinavian mythology
the Jade lake on Mount Kunlun, residence of Xi Wangmu 西王母
Chang'e, the lady in the moon (Chinese mythology)/one of the Chang'e series of PRC lunar spacecraft
fairy
The Goddess, 1934 silent film about a Shanghai prostitute, directed by 吳永剛|吴永刚[Wu2 Yong3 gang1]
goddess/prostitute (slang)
island of the immortals
lower bound (math.)/world of mortals/(of Gods) to descend to the world of mortals
heaven
lit. devils' castle/place occupied by sinister forces
(literary) paternal grandmother
another name for 西王母[Xi1 wang2 mu3], Queen Mother of the West
king's palace/throne hall
world of the immortals/fairyland/cloud nine
faintly discernible/as in a mist
palace of the Dragon King at the bottom of the Eastern Sea
the Jade Hare/the moon
